body_html:
Gotcha, thank you for the clarification. I'm not sure if this is a bug or if it is just how floating point precision works. The difference you noted:

Difference: -2.38418579102e-07

is normal for floating-point precision. Another way of summing gives the same result as g:

summed = torch.sum(torch.cat([j.unsqueeze(0), f.unsqueeze(0), c.unsqueeze(0)])).item()
(g - summed).item()
body_text:
Gotcha, thank you for the clarification. I'm not sure if this is a bug or if it is just how floating point precision works. The difference you noted:

Difference: -2.38418579102e-07

is normal for floating-point precision. Another way of summing gives the same result as g:
summed = torch.sum(torch.cat([j.unsqueeze(0), f.unsqueeze(0), c.unsqueeze(0)])).item()
(g - summed).item()
body:
Gotcha, thank you for the clarification. I'm not sure if this is a bug or if it is just how floating point precision works. The difference you noted:

> Difference: -2.38418579102e-07

is normal for floating-point precision. Another way of summing gives the same result as `g`:

```
summed = torch.sum(torch.cat([j.unsqueeze(0), f.unsqueeze(0), c.unsqueeze(0)])).item()
(g - summed).item()
```
